{{Infobox Election | election_name = United States gubernatorial elections, 2004 | country = United States | type = legislative | ongoing = no | previous_election = United States gubernatorial elections, 2003 | previous_year = 2003 | next_election = United States gubernatorial elections, 2005 | next_year = 2005 | seats_for_election = Governorships of [[Governor of Delaware|DE]], [[Governor of Indiana|IN]], [[Governor of Missouri|MO]], [[Governor of Montana|MT]], [[Governor of New Hampshire|NH]], [[Governor of North Carolina|NC]], [[Governor of North Dakota|ND]], [[Governor of Utah|UT]], [[Governor of Vermont|VT]], [[Governor of Washington|WA]], [[Governor of West Virginia|WV]], [[Governor of American Samoa|AS]], and [[Governor of Puerto Rico|PR]] | election_date = November 2, 2004 | image1 = | party1 = Republican Party (United States) | last_election1 = 28 governorships | seats_before1 =28 | seats_after1 = 28 | seat_change1 = +0 | image2 = | party2 = Democratic Party (United States) | last_election2 = 22 governorships | seats_before2 =22 | seats_after2 = 22 | seat_change2 = +0 | map_image = 2004 Gubernatorial election map.svg | map_size = 320px | map_caption = '''Results:'''{{legend|#800|Republican holds}}{{legend|#f00|Republican pickups}}{{legend|#008|Democratic holds}}{{legend|#00f|Democratic pickups}} }} The '''United States gubernatorial elections of 2004''' were held on November 2, 2004. Eleven states voted to select a governor (and in some cases, [[Lieutenant governor (United States)|lieutenant governor]]). There was no net gain in seats for either party. ==Election results== State names link to specific articles about its election {| class="wikitable" |- ! State ! Incumbent ! Party ! Status !
